greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime p such that the infinite sequence {p, p'=2p-1, p''=2p'-1, ...} begins with a string of exactly n primes.
comment: Chains of length n of nearly doubled primes.
Smallest prime beginning a complete Cunningham chain of length n of the second kind. (For the first kind see A005602.) - _Jonathan Sondow_, Oct 30 2015
link: G. Löh, Long chains of nearly doubled primes, Math. Comp., 53 (1989), 751-759.
example: a(3) = 2 because 2 is the smallest prime such that the sequence {2, 3, 5, 9, ...} begins with exactly 3 primes, where each term in the sequence is twice the preceding term minus 1.
results.author: David Terr (dterr(AT)wolfram.com), Oct 21 2002
